description: This page organizes our Spring 2025 reading group on semiadditivity and its applications. We meet on Fridays at 2:00pm in Harvard SC 309. Open invite.
terms: E<sub>n</sub>-MODULE LOCAL SYSTEMS + f<sub>!</sub> ⊣ f<sup>*</sup> ⊣ f<sub>*</sub>

talks.title: Trivial Notions
talks.description: The greatest stories do not begin with oo-category theory, and neither will ours—the germs of semiadditivity subsist willingly upon ordinary categories, ready for swab and cultivation. We will start our seminar by documenting some of the most basic semiadditive phenomena (in particular, negative one and zero semiadditivity) as it is expressible in ordinary language. Then we will anticipate higher algebraic extensions of the theory.

talks.title: I am NORMal and can be trusted with BOTH MY LEFT AND RIGHT HANDS
talks.description: In this session, we will make the first definition of semiadditivity using ambidexterity and norms. The focus will be on intuition. In particular, we will BLACK BOX the general theory of norms, to be treated in the next session.
